intro: Chamaeriphes turbinata, commonly known as the turbinated hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, turbinated (spiral-shaped) flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, reducing water loss. The flowers, which are often bright red or orange, attract various pollinators such as birds and insects.
